ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Elementary, Intermediate Korean  conversational if you take it seriously
Grammar, vocab in continuation to KREN 110.

We built on what we learned in 110. In 120, we learned a variety of things helpful for basic everyday communication. A few things we learned (but definitely not all we learned) were how to talk with older people, adjectives and how to use them in sentences, how to explain something (using "because"), how to say what we like more or most, and a variety of vocabulary.
Learned more Korean grammar and vocab, and gained confidence in speaking and writing Korean
new beginner-ish grammar and vocab
I learned many new Korean vocabulary words as well as grammar in this course.
Korean grammars and culture
I developed a greater sense of the Korean language and also culture. These insights are valuable to me as a Korean American.
Better Korean speaking and writing skills!
Korean vocabulary, grammar, and culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Teacher is outstanding  maybe a bit more organized test prep material would be nice

It's not a very difficult course. There is only occasional homework. I think more grammatical constructions could be introduced (and perhaps not be tested, but at least this would expose students to more stuff, which might be helpful).

Strengths: this class had a great sense of community thanks to our awesome professor Im Sonsaengnim, the students in the class who became friendly with each other quickly, and because the class meets every day. I felt like I learned a lot of Korean thanks to this comfortable environment even without a heavy workload. Im Sonsaengnim is a great professor who made class enjoyable and productive every day. Feedback on tests was helpful. Assignments were useful and fun. The weekly TA sessions with a native Korean speaker were also very helpful in getting a little extra conversational speaking practice every week. 
Weaknesses: are there any? Maybe the fact that Im Sonsaengnim isn't going to teach 130 next year :( that's about it.
I loved all aspects of this course!! I really enjoyed this class :)

The lectures are very engaging, and the instructor is very nice. 
It would be even better if we could have handouts for every class.
Professor Lim is a very nice and patient professor and delivers the class in a relaxing way
It would be great if the homework was small assignments once or twice a week rather than a big assignment every month or so!

Strengths - clear grading, transparency in expectation
Weakness - deemphasis on actual speaking
No weaknesses. manageable workload with a very approachable and funny Professor.
none

Learning Korean with Professor Lim felt fun and not stressful. He knows how to explain grammar points well, and since he's studied other languages, he's familiar with and empathetic to the struggles of language learners.

I really enjoyed the discussion-focused learning we had in class. The grammar lectures followed by partnered practice was effective because I was forced to use it immediately after or embarrass myself while attempting to do so. We were also pretty close as a class and it was fun to learn with everyone else.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely  you will learn Korean without being overly stressed out
Yes, Lim-ssn is great.

Yes. If you took 110 and enjoyed it, there is no reason not to continue with 120. You build on the foundations from 110 and I feel like you make a very big jump with your level. It's also just a fun class that I looked forward to almost every day  it was fun to learn Korean, there was a good sense of community in the class (students became friendly with each other quickly) and Im Sonsaengnim is a really engaging, chill professor. If you need to take care of a language requirement, I would highly recommend Korean. If you want to learn Korean, I would recommend Korean at Yale as a good way to get started.
Yes! This class is so fun, interesting, and very helpful in improving your Korean!
Yes, I would recommend this course to other students because they can learn a lot from it.
yes
Yes - its clear what you have to do and you will be able to do it if you put in the work.
Yes, especially with Lim! Great way to improve Korean skills while also not putting to much academic pressure on yourself.
Yes, it was super engaging and never felt like there was pressure to immediately understand new concepts. Definitely made me feel comfortable 100% of the time.
Yes! It's fun and you make lots of friends

Definitely! This class is extremely engaging and, while there were a lot of speaking practices which I often struggled with, it was worth all the effort. The focus is on learning by doing and it felt as we were allowed to make many mistakes as long as we improve. Prof Lim is also funny (and fun to pick on, and it goes both ways).
